Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is contrary to democratic principles and free speech.
A bureaucratic entity should not have the authority to determine the truth.
The legislation contradicts Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The bill exempts government communication from being labeled as misinformation or disinformation, which is seen as Orwellian.
The government should not have the role of deciding what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Notable Quotes: The very notion that a bureaucratic entity could in some way know the truth about anything more than anyone else is absurd and repugnant to our rights of free speech.
The fact that the bill explicitly exempts any government communication, of any level of government, from being considered misinformation or disinformation, shows how Orwellian this law will be.
